explanation: No additional symbols are required. The function contains no controlling statements (no if, switch, for, while, do-while, ?: operator or calls that could act as loop/branch control); it only performs (void) casts on its parameters to suppress unused-variable warnings. There are therefore no controlling expressions to be invariant, so nothing outside this function (types of the parameters, struct definitions, macros or other functions) can introduce a controlling expression here. Consequently, no extra symbols are needed to determine compliance with the MISRA C rule about invariant controlling expressions.
